generalInfo: On this trip you will immerse yourself in the heart of the Andean and Austral Patagonia, its infinite lakes, steppes and glaciers. You will discover the flora, fauna and the rural traditions of local communities, the local gastronomy and the natural parks of the south of Argentina.

dayInfo.description: WELCOME TO ARGENTINA! A private transfer will take you from Ezeiza International Airport to your hotel accompanied by an English-speaking guide. Buenos Aires, the vibrant capital of Argentina, combines European elegance with Latin American energy. Its wide avenues, historic neighborhoods, and bustling cultural scene make it a must-visit destination for travelers seeking history, gastronomy, and tango. Day or night, Buenos Aires charms with its unique charm and captivating atmosphere.

Your guide will meet you at your hotel, to show you the historical district (Plaza de Mayo, the Cabildo, and the main buildings), pointing out different architectural styles and impressive domes. After strolling along its Haussmann-style boulevards, head to the bohemian neighborhood of San Telmo and the very colorful La Boca, famous for its unique street, Caminito, a true open-air museum. English-speaking guide. The visit is done on foot and by public transportation. Duration: 4 hours In the afternoon, departure to a tango immersion. In the city, there are countless shows where you can watch professional couples dance Tango on a stage, but in none of these places will you find real and local tangueros. The Porteño goes to the Milongas, and that's where we will take you. Do you want to know what "Cabeceo" is? Why the music is played in "Tandas"? Why the tables are distributed around the dance floor? Why do the dancers move counterclockwise? For three to four hours, a genuine tanguero will teach you all of this, and you'll be able to enjoy Tango alongside the locals. We'll pick you up from the hotel to have a private one-hour tango lesson in a studio. Then, we'll go to a milonga to enjoy it with the locals. Throughout the night, our Tango expert guide will explain the history, styles, codes, and more, so you can understand what you're witnessing and learn about the essence of Tango. ? Departure Time: Estimated times between 6:00 PM and 8:30 PM depending on the day. ? Duration: 3.5 to 4 hours Includes: ? All transfers ? Private class (1 hour) ? Tango Guide (English/Spanish) ? Milonga entrance ? 1 drink per person (soft drink, glass of wine, or beer)

Today, you will fly to the southernmost city in the world! You've arrived at the end of the world! A small group transfer will take you from the airport to your hotel Ushuaia, nicknamed the "End of the World," is a city located in Tierra del Fuego, Argentina, offering breathtaking landscapes between snow-capped mountains and deep fjords. A starting point for expeditions to Antarctica, it is also home to a rich history, with its former prison transformed into a museum. Adventurers find here an ideal playground for exploring the wild nature.

In the morning depart to Tierra del Fuego National Park. Established in 1960 to protect the southernmost portion of the forests along the Beagle Channel, Tierra del Fuego National Park covers an area of almost 69,000 hectares. Despite being one of the most popular tours, we offer a different experience: we accompany our travelers in small groups along quieter trails, reaching hidden corners of the forest We take National Route 3 from Ushuaia and stop at a panoramic point of the Beagle Channel. Then, we arrive at Tierra del Fuego National Park and start our trek towards Lapataia Viewpoint. During our tours, we explore some trails in this exceptional forest. After this half-day of trekking, you will have a more than complete idea of the peculiarities of this ecosystem. The park is crisscrossed by mountain ranges that divide it into valleys of very difficult access. Unlike other Andean Patagonian parks, it features forests close to the maritime coast, six kilometers in length along the Beagle Channel. This forms Lapataia Bay, which in Yámana language means "wooded bay" or "bay of good wood". Total trekking distance: 4.5 km Small group tour with English-speaking guide Duration: 5 hours. National Park tickets included. Then, meet at the pier, at the Patagonia Explorer ticket office, at 2:30 pm. You will embark on a yacht excursion along the Beagle Channel to encounter sea lions and cormorants. Heading towards H Island, you will disembark for a short walk (approximately 1 hour) to explore Yámana archaeological sites, the island's fauna, and flora accompanied by your guide. You will have a breathtaking view of the Les Eclaireurs Lighthouse, situated between Argentina and Chile, where the Andes Mountains meet the sea. Additionally, you will be able to observe from a distance the mountains overlooking Ushuaia and the Chilean coast opposite. Return to Ushuaia. Duration: 4 hours. Does not include transfers to and from the port

Every land has its secrets, but not everyone is chosen to know them. A lighthouse on a lonely cape, a mysterious ship that ran aground 40 years ago, and a distinguished old estancia are just some of the icons that will reveal the unknown stories of Tierra del Fuego. Early in the morning, you will leave Ushuaia along National Route 3 and cross the Andes via Paso Garibaldi. At 450 meters above sea level, this is one of the most interesting points of the journey. After around 60 km, Lake Escondido will surprise you amid the high rock faces. As you continue, you'll notice that the ecosystem is gradually changing from forest to steppe in the northern part of the island, a region known for breeding the best lamb in the world. Next, you'll head for provincial road "A", where you'll take a gravel road and visit Estancia Rolito. This beautiful estancia, which retains the spirit of a family business founded on the tradition of sheep farming, is the first to open its doors to rural tourism. It's here that you'll pause for a delicious tea with homemade cakes, biscuits, and jams. You'll also have time to take a stroll through part of the magnificent ancient Lenga forest. After enjoying this picturesque setting, you will continue towards the Atlantic Ocean and Cape San Pablo. At this point, you will climb a secluded mountain at the foot of which is an abandoned lighthouse (easy walk). When you reach the top of this lighthouse, you'll see the Desdemona, a ship that has been abandoned for almost 40 years and invites you to step back in time. It was on a cold winter's morning in 1983 that this enormous ship ran aground on the shores of the Argentine Sea. After exploring this mysterious giant, you'll pay a visit to local fishermen who will invite you to enjoy a home-cooked lunch of fresh fish on their premises. You will be welcomed into their home by Silvia and Miguel. Return to your hotel after a unique experience. Excursion in a small group with an English/Spanish-speaking guide. Available only from October to April

A walk through a unique and wonderful place in Tierra del Fuego, with a magical display of colors... from the green of the forest and the red of the peat to the turquoise of the lagoon. Today you will discover a unique and wonderful place in Tierra del Fuego: Laguna Esmeralda. We depart from the city via National Route No. 3 until we reach the starting point where we prepare to continue on foot. The approximate duration from the start of the hike to reaching the lagoon is 2 hours, during which we will traverse the subantarctic forest, peat valleys, and rivers with beaver dams. Once we reach the lagoon, we allocate a moment to appreciate its beauty, and its unique color, and to discover the surroundings that give this place a particular charm. There, we will stop to replenish energy with a lunch box and a drink before embarking on the return journey along the trail that led us there. Group excursion, with an English-speaking guide Distance: 9 km | Positive elevation gain: 300 meters (approximately 2.5 hours one way) Physical fitness is required for this hike; those with physical restrictions or lacking appropriate clothing and footwear will not be able to participate. You must bring a backpack, waterproof footwear with good grip soles, warm clothing, and a waterproof layer.

Take off towards El Calafate and the glacier region! Pay attention during the landing, you will have the chance to admire the Argentino Lake right next to the airport. At night, you will be welcomed into Gabriel's house, a friendly abode where you will feel right at home in the heart of southern Patagonia! Warm atmosphere and delicious dishes, such as the seasonal vegetable casserole or the typical lamb goulash!! Accompanied, of course, by good wines! The ideal opportunity to share an exquisite meal in the company of locals and in an intimate setting, away from tourist crowds.

Guided departure from El Calafate along the old Route 15, the "estancias trail," which connects different stories of Patagonia: indigenous peoples, pioneers, and inhabitants. Once inside Los Glaciares National Park, at the end of the road, you will reach Estancia Nibepo Aike where all the stories converge. There, where over 100 years ago the first settler arrived, there is now an estancia dedicated to cattle, sheep, and horse breeding. You will tour its pens and sheds, where you will witness a demonstration of manual sheep shearing. In the Quincho of Estancia Nibepo Aike, a typical Patagonian lamb barbecue is served, accompanied by salads, desserts, and beverages included. Then, a walk is taken to the Pioneers' pier, from where navigation begins on the South Arm and Rico Arm of Lake Argentino. Disembarkation at Monedas Beach, accessible only by boat. A 40-minute walk is made, allowing you to appreciate the native forest, where wild cattle still remain, remnants of the ranching era before these lands were declared a National Park. The trail penetrates the Lenga forest until the Perito Moreno Glacier is spotted through the foliage. Upon leaving the forest density, you will descend towards the Sur Glacier viewpoint: a rocky beach with privileged views. Back on board, the navigation travels along the southern face of the Perito Moreno Glacier. Opportunity to observe the ice detachments and appreciate how its front approaches the Magallanes Peninsula, sometimes mounted on the rock, thus forming a natural dam. Disembarkation at Bajo de las Sombras port, to access by land to the walkways located 6 km away. The tour starts from the highest point, with a panoramic view, and then descends towards the Tempanos Channel. Throughout the tour, you will admire the magnitude of the glacier from different angles. After spending more than an hour on the walkways, you will return to El Calafate by vehicle at sunset. Lunch included. Small group activity, with English/Spanish-speaking guide Park entrance included Note: In case of total or partial impossibility of navigation, an alternative plan is implemented for accessing the Perito Moreno Glacier from Estancia Nibepo Aike by land, and if possible, navigation is made in front of the Glacier.

Departure for Punta Bandera, from where you will embark to sail through the Canal de los Témpanos. You will enter the Seno Mayo of Lake Argentino. You will disembark at Bahía Toro and, accompanied by a guide, you will take an interpretative walk through the Patagonian Andean forest (composed of cherry trees, cinnamon trees, lengas, and ñires) until you reach a specimen of a centenary cherry tree with a trunk of more than three meters in diameter. Then, you will cross the forest until you reach a stream, fed by a waterfall, from where you can observe a formation of limestone rocks with a wall about 180 meters high and 100 meters wide. You will stay in this place until it is time to return to the boat that will take you to your next destination. From Bahía Toro, you will continue sailing along the Seno Mayo of Lake Argentino, where you can observe the hanging glaciers of Cerro Mayo and Cerro Negro. Then, you will disembark with the guide and start a walk of approximately 1,000 meters in the Patagonian Andean forest, following the course of a stream. You will be guided until you reach the viewpoint from where you will observe the aforementioned hanging glaciers and enjoy, with panoramic views of 360°, a wonderful landscape that will take your breath away. You will have time in this memorable environment to observe Cerro Mayo and Cerro Blanco, then you will return to the boat that will take you to the north wall of the Perito Moreno Glacier. Once there, you will disembark at the Puerto Moreno dock, located at the foot of the walkways, to visit the walkways for about 2 hours. At the end of the excursion, you will return to the city of El Calafate around 6:00 PM. Duration: Approximately 10 hours Group excursion, with English/Spanish-speaking guide. Entrance included Box lunch included Recommendations: Bring sunglasses, sunscreen, warm clothing, gloves, and comfortable shoes.

Departure by bus for El Chaltén, the "trekking capital" of Argentina. After a 3-hour drive across the Patagonian steppes, you arrive at the village from where you can admire the famous Fitz Roy mountain. Afternoon free to explore this picturesque village and its surroundings. "Chaltén" is the name with which the local Tehuelches called the hill that Perito Moreno would later christen Fitz Roy. In the Aonikenk language, it means "smoking mountain" and the natives, like many early explorers, assumed it was a volcano. This small village has been declared the "national trekking capital", as there is a wide variety of trails, with different levels of difficulty depending on each person's physical ability.

Free day to hike to Laguna de los Tres. This hike is one of the most beautiful in the area and starts at the end of the main street, San Martin, after the parking lot. A sign "Senda el Fitz Roy" indicates the starting point. You will then have a 10.2 km (approximately 5 hours, excluding stops) hike to reach the final destination. After a final ascent, you will be there! You'll be at an altitude of 1,170 meters. Mount Fitz Roy will emerge in front of you, and a turquoise blue lake will stretch at your feet. The trail is fully marked and well-maintained. Another option is to take a taxi (book directly at the hotel) to Hostería el Pilar. From there, you start towards Laguna de los Tres, taking a different trail than the return route. You will arrive at the viewpoint of Glacier Piedras Blancas, which starts from the Rio Blanco bridge and involves an 800-meter elevation gain. Continue your path towards the Poincenot campsite, towards Laguna de los Tres, and from there, begin your return to the accommodation passing by Laguna Capri. This way, you avoid 2 km and get to admire another trail. Please prepare a picnic for this day. Important: The last kilometer to Laguna de los Tres is of difficult difficulty. It is a steep and rocky ascent that takes approximately 1 hour to complete. Total round trip: 20 km - Approximately 9 hours.

Free day for one of the possible self-guided walks in the area. In the afternoon/ night departure from El Chaltén by regular bus in the direction to Los Antiguos, a small town located in the north of Santa Cruz province. You will go through 650 km along the emblematic Route 40. Night on board. We suggest you take a lunch bag for dinner. Bus trip has a duration of 12 hs approx

Arrival at Los Antiguos in the morning. A driver will be waiting for you to take you to your hotel. Los Antiguos is a small town in the extreme northwest of Santa Cruz, on the shores of Lake Buenos Aires, which in different months of the year dresses up to receive its visitors. This small village of about 1500 inhabitants is surrounded by a striking landscape, with lakes and the snow-capped peaks of the Andes Mountains, which attract large numbers of tourists every year.

Today you will probably discover the most captivating archaeological site of Patagonia, La Cueva de las Manos. In the heart of the Rio Pinturas Canyon, these caves are a unique testimony to the presence of men in the region almost 10,000 years ago. But it is all the large amount of hands contours that impresses most, and their almost perfect conservation until today. You will be invited to follow the footsteps of the first inhabitants of Patagonia as you walk along the paths they used to travel through the canyon. The opportunity also to discover a part of the legendary route 40 less known to the general public, where you can observe the native fauna such as condors, guanacos or pumas. You will participate in beautiful hikes along the Canyon Caracoles, the Canyon Rio Pinturas or even through the astonishing "Tierra de Colores" (Land of Colors), ideal site to contemplate the chromatic richness of the rock formations. 9:00 am Pick up in front of the hotel 11.45 am Arrival at the Cueva de las Manos and departure for a short hike in the Rio Pinturas Canyon 1.30 p.m. Lunch and visit to the interpretation center 3:00 p.m. On the way back you will stop to walk in the Rio Pinturas Canyon and the "Land of colors" Lunch included

Discover the dizzying path through the Andes, immense lakes, steppe and Patagonian forests to the neighboring country, Chile. You can observe Mount San Valentín, an imposing summit of 4,058 meters, as well as the main mountains of Campo de Hielo Norte. On site, you will navigate on General Carrera Lake (or Lake Buenos Aires in its Argentinian part), one of the largest lakes in South America (1850 km2). The geology of its coasts is very varied, and includes, among other things, a base dating from the Paleozoic. These rocks composed of Calcium Carbonate have been shaped by the erosion of the waters of the lake, and have dug superb caves where the light of Patagonia plays with water and rock to give an enchanting spectacle. 7:30 am Departure from your hotel 8:00 am Arrival at the Chilean border (don't forget your passport!) 9:00 am Visit to Chile Chico 1:00 p.m. Start of navigation 2:30 p.m. Lunch, overlooking the lake 4:00 p.m. Return 8:00 p.m. Arrival in Los Antiguos Lunch included

Early departure in the direction of Comodoro Rivadavia Airport. Around 6 hours. Private transportation. Arrive at the airport in the early afternoon to take a flight to Buenos Aires. Private transfer to the hotel.

You will visit the northern districts of the city of Buenos Aires by bike. You will discover Plaza San Martin, the aristocratic districts of Recoleta and Barrio Parque, the parks of Palermo and Rosedal, and the Congreso of Buenos Aires. The first stop is Plaza San Martín. If you close your eyes, you can imagine this place in colonial Buenos Aires 200 years ago. It is here where the inhabitants of Buenos Aires defended themselves during the famous English invasions. In addition, this is where General San Martín, the greatest hero in national history, prepared his grenadiers for the battles of Independence. You are already in the heart of the Retiro neighborhood, and when you look up, you will find that this green park is surrounded by architectural pearls. One of them is the famous Kavanagh building, which was the arrowhead of modern architecture in Argentina. The tour continues along Avenida del Libertador, which was once the city's first coastal walk, along the Río de la Plata. Today it is a very long, elegant and tree-lined avenue. After a few minutes, you arrive at the Recoleta district: you will discover the history of the most elegant area of ??the city and its first inhabitants, the mysterious "Recollect monks". Where their old farm used to be, it is today one of the most famous cemeteries in the world, home to the great bourgeois families of the country, most of the presidents of the Republic and even the emblematic "Evita" Perón. The Recoleta Cemetery invites you to take a short walk, and you will no doubt be amazed at the diversity of the funerary architecture, stained glass windows and statues. You pick up your bike again to discover the Parque 3 de Febrero, also known as the "parks of Palermo". The park, with its green and its lagoon, is one of the most beautiful places in Buenos Aires, it is the green heart of the city. You can take a walk in the Rosedal, a garden that, as its name implies, is covered with an immense variety of roses. On the way back, you will cross Barrio Norte, Palermo and the city center, where the road becomes interurban. The night slowly arrives: the landscapes, activities and aromas change. The last stop is in the Plaza del Congreso. From here you can see the imposing building that houses the Chamber of Deputies and the Senator. Small-group excursion with an English-speaking guide. Duration: around 4 hours Departure at 2:30 p.m, you must arrive 15 minutes before. Total distance: 14 km

It's time to wrap the last souvenirs and enjoy the atmosphere of your hotel neighborhood! According to your flight schedule, a private transfer will drive you to Ezeiza International Airport. End of our services
